did.unittitle: Utica, NY, Building Trades Council Minute Books, 1933-1934
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Meeting minutes of the Building Trades Council of Utica, New York, from May 5, 1933 to July 26, 1934.

bioghist.p: The Building Trades Council is a constituionally mandated department of the AFL-CIO. It was started on February 10, 1908 to overcome the jurisdictional conflicts in the building and construction trade unions. It helps coordinate local unions in the building trades, with contract negotiations and apprenticeship and training programs.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of one bound volume of meeting minutes of the Building Trades Council of Utica, New York, from May 5, 1933 to July 26, 1934.

accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.p: Utica, NY, Building Trades Council Minute Books #5829. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.
